intro: Urceolina hartwegiana, commonly known as the Hartweg's urn plant, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped flowers. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant features a compact, herbaceous growth habit with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow, are arranged in umbels, a common trait among members of its family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
